objects.name: Submit KITs, KIQs, and intelligence requirements
objects.description:
This object is deprecated as its content has been merged into the enterprise domain. Please see the [PRE](http://attack.mitre.org/matrices/enterprise/pre/) matrix for its replacement. The prior content of this page has been preserved [here](https://attack.mitre.org/versions/v7/techniques/T1237).

Once they have been created, intelligence requirements, Key Intelligence Topics (KITs), and Key Intelligence Questions (KIQs) are submitted into a central management system. (Citation: ICD204) (Citation: KIT-Herring)

external_references.description: Office of the Director of National Intelligence. (2015, January 02).  Retrieved March 5, 2017.
Jan P. Herring. (1999). Key Intelligence Topics: A Process to Identify and Define Intelligence Needs. Retrieved May 19, 2017.

objects.x_mitre_detectable_by_common_defenses_ex: Normally, defender is unable to detect.  Few agencies and commercial organizations may have unique insights.
objects.x_mitre_difficulty_for_adversary_explana: Normal aspect of adversary planning lifecycle.  May not be done by all adversaries.
